nuclear_power_organizations.name: European Atomic Energy Community
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To coordinate the member states' research programs for the peaceful use of nuclear energy.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: International Atomic Energy Agency
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To promote the peaceful use of nuclear energy and to inhibit its use for any military purpose, including nuclear weapons.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: International Centre for Synchrotron-Light for Experimental Science Applications in the Middle East
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To foster scientific and technological excellence in the Middle East and neighboring regions.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: Korean Peninsula Energy Development Organization
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: Established to implement the Agreed Framework signed by North Korea and the United States.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: Nuclear Energy Agency
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To assist its member countries in maintaining and further developing, through international cooperation, the scientific, technological, and legal bases required for a safe, environmentally friendly, and economical use of nuclear energy.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: United Nations Atomic Energy Commission
members: Members of the United Nations at that time
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To deal with the problems raised by the discovery of atomic energy and to make proposals for the control of nuclear energy.

nuclear_power_organizations.name: World Association of Nuclear Operators
members: Operators of nuclear power plants from more than 30 countries, including but not limited to: United States, United Kingdom, France, Canada, Japan, Russia, China, South Korea, Germany, Ukraine, Sweden, Spain, Finland, Belgium, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Bulgaria, Romania, Brazil, South Africa, India, Pakistan, United Arab Emirates
nuclear_power_organizations.purpose: To maximize the safety and reliability of nuclear power plants worldwide by working together to assess, benchmark, and improve performance through mutual support, exchange of information, and emulation of best practices.
